intro: Hedyotis rivalis, commonly known as the golden star or small redroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, bright yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Hedyotis rivalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
